attributes.action: Create a strategy for international student employability to support graduates.
attributes.additional_details:
International students contribute £41.9 billion annually to the UK economy. 
They bring valuable skills and expertise that can benefit the UK workforce and support industries in need of skilled workers.
They make substantial contributions to knowledge production, and institution-building activities through the infusion of diverse and critical perspectives.
As hosts of international students, the government has a responsibility to ensure their wellbeing and success.
attributes.background: We want the government to allocate resources and enact legislation to ensure equitable employment opportunities for international students. We urge the government to ensure continuance of the Graduate Route visa to provide international students with enough time to secure employment in the UK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Commit to keeping the Graduate Visa Route: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/654811

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
